content: On October 30, 1995, the Atlanta Braves celebrated their first World Series title since relocating from Milwaukee. The Braves clinched the championship by defeating the Cleveland Indians in Game 6, with Tom Glavine throwing a brilliant eight-inning shutout, allowing only one hit. This victory marked the culmination of a dominant season and solidified the team's place in baseball history, with Chipper Jones earning a rookie of the year honor that same season. The 1995 championship remains a defining moment for the franchise.
